topic.title: Store Zerosite like Freenet, with shared storage?
topic.body: Is it possible to contribute to Zeronet with storage and bandwidth in the same fashion as Freenet, with a shared storage. As of now, unless I missed a feature, I have to  visit sites in order to become a seeder, so I have to manually visit as many sites as I can in order to help them launch/stay active. But with Freenet, I just give some storage space and then it will help the entire system stay alive. Same with blockchains, as soon as you become a node you contribute to the decentralization and resiliency. Any way to do something similar with Zeronet?

1534839963_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nw.body: I tried to use Twister but it doesn't seem to work. I am assuming this is the Twister we're talking about: http://twister.net.co/ I did install it some time ago on my computer(s) but I wasn't sure the project was still alive so I was reluctant to switch to it as the main blogging platform. Is there any reason to keep using Twister instead of just using/developing a Zeronet equivalent?

1534878028_18e4U5WvC4d8Megkv2Sqek9HzrG6T.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_457_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): if you want to share many 0sites without visitting them one by one, i have these ideas: [...]

Thanks for your comments, I'll try all methods.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_457_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): if you want to share many 0sites without visitting them one by one, i have these ideas: [...]

On Windows to handle large files I'm using EmEditor: https://www.emeditor.com/

1535287918_14UupgrdnT7Y8vMES7aqUFgD1fC5R.body: I've just added "data/1PzpXVd3ghveQUsiKn8JBStVexcywtQ97V/trackers.txt" in the config settings. I don't know where to look to see if it changes anything, all I want is to contribute to Zeronet.

1541289967_1NcVwrBpf91ownXuSgYnHBZCWjoiN.body: This is a very interesting question, thanks. For TV series, right now I'd say Westworld. Some elements of the illuminati in it. I'll think about movies and come back later here.
Still as a TV series I guess Mr Robot is a must see.
Here is a movie that could also be of interest to you: Her (2013). https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Her_%28film%29

1540133695_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY.body: Anyone could do a TOX vs Ring.io (https://ring.cx/) review?

1541833193_19HaBBc1M3usmLxayEasbaTkeZ3Tt.body: You can fund the project here: https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/help_zeronet/donate/

1541904191_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: Very good. I've submitted a few alternatives, for example cryptpad: https://cryptpad.fr/ which I'm using for months for business purpose with my team.
For our team, we look for: open-source, end-to-end encrypted including on the server if there is one. In that regard many of the suggested items wouldn't match our specification sheet.
